author: TylerLeonhardt
body:
(Let me know if we should separate this into two issues)

Right now, TabExpansion2 can only return all the results for a given query and the only way to cancel it is to stop it by calling PowerShell.Stop or Ctrl+C

There should be a more robust way of getting completions.

Some ways I've thought about it:
* Support some better way to cancel and return a partial result (in C# I'd love to use a CancellationToken)
* Support a way to ask for the first X completions for the perf gains

This would make intellisense in VSCode so much snappier because partial results are something that is unachievable right now.
title: Allow tab expansion to be cancellable and/or add a Count param of # of results you want
